p: The typical clinical symptoms include fever, hemorrhage, headache, back pain, abdominal pain, acute renal dysfunction, and hypotension ( Ministry of Health 1998). In China, HFRS is predominantly caused by Hantaan virus and Seoul virus, which have Apodemus agrarius and Rattus norvegicus, respectively, as their rodent hosts ( Yan et al. 2007). Transmission of hantaviruses from rodents to humans is believed to occur through inhalation of aerosols contaminated by virus shed in excreta, saliva, and urine of infected animals ( Clement 2003; Shi 2003; Song 1999).
